actionUnits.condition: Call WinLose.Winlevel() on GameCondition to activate WinUI (script guid d8624f87f98aa484bb7925103f5d458e). Expect WinUI.SetActive(true). Ensure WinUI reference is set via PrefabInstance modifications (objectReference fileID 109963297).

Call WinLose.loselevel() on GameCondition to activate LoseUI (script guid d8624f87f98aa484bb7925103f5d458e). Expect LoseUI.SetActive(true). Ensure LoseUI reference is set via PrefabInstance modifications (objectReference fileID 109963299).
Call WinLose.Restart() on GameCondition (script guid d8624f87f98aa484bb7925103f5d458e). Method is currently empty; verify no exceptions.

Exercise AttachToElevator (MonoBehaviour id 764083142; m_Script guid 077cb2d6a53b18f4ea7d76e72138fc77) by causing physics trigger enter/exit on platform2 (1). Preconditions: (1) BoxCollider id 764083144 must be set to m_IsTrigger=1 (currently 0) OR a Rigidbody must exist on at least one of the colliding objects; (2) The serialized field 'player' on this component must reference this same GameObject (platform2 (1)), because the script checks 'if (gameObject == player)'. With these set, move a Player collider (with Rigidbody) into the platform's trigger volume to invoke OnTriggerEnter and then move it out to invoke OnTriggerExit. Expected behavior: on enter, player.transform.SetParent(platform2 (1).transform, true); on exit, player.transform.parent = null.

MonoBehaviour id 2013310826 (guid 077cb2d6a53b18f4ea7d76e72138fc77) matches script AttachToElevator. Serialized field 'player' is null (fileID 0). BoxCollider id 2013310828 exists with m_IsTrigger=0; GameObject has no Rigidbody. Script only reacts on OnTriggerEnter/OnTriggerExit, but logic checks if (gameObject == player), which will be false (player is null) and collider is not a trigger; thus callbacks will not execute as-is. To cover the code, we need: (a) assign 'player' to this GameObject or correct the comparison to 'other.gameObject', and (b) ensure a trigger collider and at least one Rigidbody on one of the interacting objects. No m_Calls/EventTrigger present in scene config.

Try to exercise AttachToElevator.OnTriggerEnter/OnTriggerExit on MonoBehaviour id 666190386 (script guid 077cb2d6a53b18f4ea7d76e72138fc77). Note: There are no public parameterless methods or UnityEvent m_Calls to invoke manually. The only code paths are private OnTriggerEnter/OnTriggerExit (Collider). Current BoxCollider (id 666190388) has m_IsTrigger=0 and the GameObject has no Rigidbody, so Unity will not invoke OnTrigger callbacks unless another collider is set as Trigger and at least one of the colliders has a Rigidbody. Additionally, the serialized field 'player' is null and the script checks 'if (gameObject == player)' which will always be false here, so even if OnTriggerEnter/Exit fire, no parenting occurs unless 'player' references this same GameObject. Manual triggering of methods is not possible due to lack of public parameterless APIs.

Physics OnTriggerEnter should fire on MonoBehaviour_0 (id: 397541585) attached to platform2 (PrefabInstance fileID: 397541581) using script guid 077cb2d6a53b18f4ea7d76e72138fc77 (AttachToElevator). Current BoxCollider (id: 397541586) has m_IsTrigger=0 and platform2 has no Rigidbody; thus OnTriggerEnter will not fire unless: (1) BoxCollider.m_IsTrigger is set to 1, and (2) at least one of the colliding objects has a Rigidbody (e.g., the Player), and (3) the script's public field 'player' is assigned. Note: the script compares 'gameObject == player', meaning to cover the SetParent branch, 'player' must reference platform2 itself; otherwise the condition is false and no parenting occurs.

Physics OnTriggerExit should fire on MonoBehaviour_0 (id: 397541585) attached to platform2 (PrefabInstance fileID: 397541581) using script guid 077cb2d6a53b18f4ea7d76e72138fc77 (AttachToElevator). Current BoxCollider (id: 397541586) has m_IsTrigger=0 and platform2 has no Rigidbody; thus OnTriggerExit will not fire unless: (1) BoxCollider.m_IsTrigger is set to 1, and (2) at least one of the colliding objects has a Rigidbody (e.g., the Player), and (3) the script's public field 'player' is assigned. Note: to cover the 'player.transform.parent = null' branch, the prior OnTriggerEnter path would need to have executed, and the same 'gameObject == player' condition applies.

Scene mapping: GameObject 'ScoreManager' (fileID 1468535024) has a MonoBehaviour with m_Script GUID f7de224e5fee443418417f9f2bfa2998 (class Scoremanager). Effective instance values come from the PrefabInstance overrides: ScoreText -> fileID 109963300, AmountUI -> fileID 109963301, Timer -> fileID 109963298, StarValue=1, winAmount=6, winlosescript -> fileID 1943288799. Auto events Start() and Update() will run on play and update UI text/timer. The event we need to trigger under test conditions is Scoremanager.changescore(int), repeatedly on star pickup, until score == winAmount to cover the Winlevel() path. However, ScoreManager has no Rigidbody/Collider/EventTrigger and the only public method that changes state requires an int parameter, which the Trigger action does not support. We need either: (a) a collider/EventTrigger/UnityEvent (m_Calls) that invokes changescore(int), or (b) a parameterless proxy method to increment score.

Validate dependency chain: Scoremanager.winlosescript is assigned (object/component fileID 1943288799). Invoke WinLose.Winlevel() directly (parameterless) to simulate the post-win path that Scoremanager would call once score == winAmount.
